column4: I have a silly question... so I have an internet connection, modem, directly connected to my home server, which then connects to my wifi router (netgear n600) is there a way to make it so my server doesn't look at all traffic as though it was coming directly from the router, but from the devices connected to it?
another option is setting up an SSH tunnel
those are your two basic choices for this
So there is no way for it without setup on each computer?
not too far away, it's been just fine for me
each computer will require setup, that is correct
I would have to go buy a switch for that right?
don't think you need a switch, just make sure to open up your wireless router to let the connections come in for the VPN or SSH server
I was just hoping to be able to do it in a straightforward way, I have both ubuntu and windows computers at home
that process is called "port forwarding" also sometimes known as "opening a port" - though if you learn about firewall rules the pedantic ones will tell you there's no such thing :P
but those are the common names for the process
I get all of that, but every piece of traffic that the server sees is coming from the router, its doesn't see that, Its a  2nd 'nat'?
sorry I don't quite follow, and I've gtg keep working, good luck
if you explain a little more generally (like I'm an alien) what you want, i might be able to suggest some things
